frameDefinitions: A Speaker either agrees to or refuses to engage in a Proposed_action, proposed by an Interlocutor. ''
An Agent attempts to achieve a Goal.
A Speaker addresses a Proposal made by an Interlocutor, either agreeing to it or rejecting it.
An Agent suddenly and often violently separates the Whole_patient into two or more smaller Pieces, resulting in the Whole_patient no longer existing as such.
AForgoer decides not to partake in something ordinary that is otherwise Desirable.
A Speaker makes a commitment to an Addressee to carry out some future action.
frameExamples: They <t>agreed</t> to express their outrage with editorials in today's paper.
They were <t>rebuffed</t> again in the larger city of Provo. CNI
He <t>ripped</t> <t>up</t> the letter faster than you can say 'Jack Robbins'. INI
You <t>promised</t> me you'd come to my graduation.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Speaker</fen> is the person to whom a particular action has been proposed and who responds to the request or offer made.
This is the person who proposed the <fen>Proposed_action</fen>  to the <fen>Speaker</fen> and to whom the <fen>Speaker</fen> communicates  their response.
The <fen>Proposed_action</fen> is an action that the <fen>Speaker</fen> would perform if they were to accept or refuse the request or offer.
The time interval during which the <fen>Speaker</fen> makes their verbal response concerning the proposed action.
The location in which the <fen>Speaker</fen>  gives their verbal response to the proposed action.
The <fen>Agent</fen> makes an attempt to achieve a <fen>Goal</fen>.
The <fen>Goal</fen> is what the <fen>Agent</fen> attempts to achieve.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the attempt occurs.
The place where an attempt is made.
The <fen>Speaker</fen> is the person who communicates the reply or response.

This is the person who made the <fen>Proposal</fen> to the <fen>Speaker</fen> and to whom the <fen>Speaker</fen> communicates  their response. This frame element stands in for the <fen>Proposal</fen> and is only licensed when the <fen>Proposal</fen>  can be understood from the context.
The <fen>Proposal</fen> is the prior communication or action to which a response is given.
The time interval during which the <fen>Speaker</fen> makes their verbal response.
The location in which the <fen>Speaker</fen>  makes a verbal response.
The conscious entity, generally a person, that performs the intentional action that results in the <fen>Whole_patient</fen> being broken into <fen>Pieces</fen>.
The entity which is destroyed by the <fen>Agent</fen> and that ends up broken into <fen>Pieces</fen>.
The fragments of the <fen>Whole_patient</fen> that result from the <fen>Agent</fen>'s action.
An event which leads to the fragmentation of the <fen>Whole_patient</fen>.
This role identifies the time when the <fen>Agent</fen> breaks up the <fen>Whole_patient</fen>.
This role identifies the place where the <fen>Agent</fen> breaks the <fen>Whole_patient</fen> into pieces.
The <fen>Forgoer</fen> decides not to partake in the desirable activity or event.
<fen>Desirable</fen> identifies the event or activity in which is the <fen>Forgoer</fen> does not partake.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> at which the the forgoing occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the forgoing occurs.

The Speaker is the person who commits him/herself to do something.  Speaker is usually the External Argument of predicative uses of the target or the Genitive modifier of a noun: <fex name='Speaker'>Jo</fex> made a <t>promise</t> to me. <fex name='Speaker'>Jo</fex> <t>promised</t> me she would cook dinner. <fex name='Speaker'>Jo's</fex> <t>promise</t> to cook dinner came to nothing.

The Speaker's commitment can be made to an Addressee.  With those words which allow this frame element to be expressed, Addressee usually occurs as a PP Complement headed by <ment>to</ment> or the (Indirect) Object of verbs: Kim made a <t>promise</t> <fex name='Addressee'>to me</fex>. Kim <t>promised</t> <fex name='Addressee'>me</fex> that everything would be okay.

An expression of the commitment made by the Speaker expresses the frame element Message.  Message is expressed as a finite or non-finite clausal Complement or an NP Object: I <t>swore</t> <fex name='Message'>that I would never make the same mistake again</fex>. The owner finally <t>consented</t> <fex name='Message'>to sell the business</fex>. They <t>threatened</t> <fex name='Message'>revenge</fex>.
Topic expressions are not very frequent in this frame. They can occur with noun targets. Jo made endless <t>promises</t> <fex name='Topic'>about working harder at school</fex>.

As with other frames in the Communication domain, the <t>Medium</t> of communication may be expressed. Medium is the physical entity or channel used to transmit the Message. Bob <t>threatened</t> the workers <fex name='Medium'>in Spanish</fex>.
The time period during which the <fen>Speaker</fen> makes the commitment.
The location in which the <fen>Speaker</fen> makes the commitment.
listRoleExamples: <fex>On the bridge</fex> he attempted to put the wig on.
<fex>Iran</fex> on Saturday rejected Europe's proposal for ending the standoff over Tehran's nuclear program.

But senior SLN officials had rebuffed <fex>the man who is ever so willing to please
the guerrillas</fex>.
Dr. Carolyn Herrington has accepted <fex>our offer to become Dean of the College of Education</fex> .
This must make <fex>yesterday's</fex> Taliban rebuff all the more wounding.
Legislation that would have required smaller school districts to share administrators has been rebuffed repeatedly <fex>in the Oklahoma House of Representatives</fex>.
<fex>I and I alone</fex> can shatter the gem and break the curse.
Shattering someone's confidence is a little different than shattering <fex>a dish</fex>.
I smashed the toy boat <fex>to flinders</fex>.

The chancellor <fex>yesterday</fex> promised to increase defence spending in real terms next
year.
The july framework has reaffirmed what was promised <fex>at Doha</fex>.
